page.title: 09H & A Trowers Food Mill
page.content: At{Lower Dicker}there is a mill. The company is called H & A Trowers. It used to make animal foods, but now it just sells the animal foods that are transported to the mill. The goods are stored in an enormous warehouse. Barley, oats, and sunflower seeds, biscuits waste and fish meal were some of the things used to make the animal food pellets. The mill itself is 106 years old. At the moment there are five people on the work force. Two people work in the warehouse and the other three people work in the office and go out to farms to get the orders for animal foods. Before the factory was built the land was used for fields. The mill is now disused because farmers weren't buying enough food. Only four men are needed to run the mill properly. by Joanne Barnes & Sarah Tardif.
